messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] a brag on Marty (was experience and diet (was Praisi...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/8/03 12:49:07 AM, LOWRIEK@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/8/03 12:49:07 AM, LOWRIEK@... writes:

<< How exciting for him. Sandra, did they meet any of the dogs on the force?
A
friend of mine trained a Belgian Malinois in Schutzhund, her name was Hella.
>>

I'll ask him! He couldn't remember the breed of the attack dogs, so maybe
that was it. He said "no," about every breed I guessed. He said there were
three attack dogs that day, and they talked a lot about points on ratings of
tests of some sort, and the special quirks of individual dogs. Another day there
were drug sniffing dogs (and I don't know how many that day).

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] a brag on Marty (was experience and diet (was Praisi...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 07/06/2003 06:32:45 Pacific Daylight Time, ... Have really enjoyed reading this stuff about Marty and the police cadet week. How exciting
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 07/06/2003 06:32:45 Pacific Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> He got his first "schoolday" and his first graduation ceremony all in one
> week.
>

Have really enjoyed reading this stuff about Marty and the police cadet week.
How exciting for him. Sandra, did they meet any of the dogs on the force? A
friend of mine trained a Belgian Malinois in Schutzhund, her name was Hella.
She was a cool dog, and Janet did a great job with her, but she was sooo much
dog, she ended up selling her to the Albequerque(sp?) police. Just wondered if
she was still around.Very off topic.
Nancy in BC


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] a brag on Marty (was experience and diet (was Praisi...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/7/2003 1:09:30 PM Mountain Daylight Time, ... He said he is, but he s scaref of the normal academy.  Once they over heard through the all
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/7/2003 1:09:30 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
ddzimlew@... writes:

> Has he talked to you about whether he still thinks police work would be
> interesting after his week at the academy?
>
>

He said he is, but he's scaref of the normal academy. Once they over heard
through the all some stuff involving large numbers of difficult push-up combos.

Two of the officers told me in a real way (not just the offhanded reminder
tone) that when he's fifteen I should get him into their next program up which
is twice a week with ride-alongs and helping with traffic accident scenes
sometimes. He's interested. It's six months away.

He really liked the crime scene stuff a lot. They set up a scenario like a
test for groups of kids to see what they could discover. Sounded really cool.

Sandra
